channel.title: How do i change exp ea hit?
channel.description: I need help whit changing exp ea hit.Anyone can help me?

item.title: How do i change exp ea hit?
item.dc:creator: @forbiddenlegend forbiddenlegend
item.description:
@forbiddenlegend wrote:

I changed into this but its still not working.

if (FightType != 3) {
TotalExp = (double) (800 * hitDiff);
TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate);
addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), SkillID);
} else {
TotalExp = (double) (800 * hitDiff);
TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate);
addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerAttack);
addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerDefence);
addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerStrength);
}
TotalExp = (double) (800 * hitDiff);
TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate);
addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp) / 4, playerHitpoints);[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 31, 2008, 06:57:04 am[/size][hr]Ooh and both of them were 320.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 31, 2008, 11:58:25 am[/size][hr]Can anyone help me?

item.title: How do i change exp ea hit?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Well, when you search “exprate”, and go through all of them, two different numbers should show up. The larger number is the normal rate, and the smaller number is the HP rate.

~Jc22493

item.title: How do i change exp ea hit?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

You’re welcome.
P.S. - You should find the DAMAGE PER HIT to HP ratio first. Then, when you reduce or increase the rate, you can keep the ratio the same.

~Jc22493

item.title: How do i change exp ea hit?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Go to your Client.Java and search “exprate”.
Change those numbers to whatever rate you want the training xp.
If the original number was 2000*hitdiff, then each damage the player does will give them 2000 damage.

~Jc22493

Read full topic
